description:
People Operations is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers and across Alphabet. The Equity and Inclusion Strategy team closely partners with leaders and employee stakeholders across Google and Alphabet to increase their capability to integrate equity, inclusion and diversity (EID). As a team, we're committed to do what is right in all aspects of their organization and business: to be fair and inclusive, all in the service of social and racial equity. We're also stretching what is possible in EID, through innovation, while executing approaches that drive excellence, accountability, progress and systemic change.

As an EID Learning Experience Designer, you will work closely with the Chief Equity and Inclusion Strategist, to research, design, and facilitate EID experiential learning approaches and programs that can be scaled for and implemented across the Bets (Alphabet companies).
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 6 years of experience designing learning materials and tools that addresses equity, inclusion and diversity in organizational settings.
  • Experience implementing and facilitating innovative learning experiences.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in an educational field, with a focus on experiential learning design and facilitation/social change (racial and gender equity).
  • Ability to take direction, while working independently and collaboratively to grow and be challenged, and ability to manage multiple projects/programs simultaneously.
  • Skilled at conducting, and applying qualitative/quantitative academic and industry research to learning content and design.
  • Comfortability learning, designing and applying various technologies and graphic design to enhance learning experiences.
  • Comfortability being malleable and responding to emerging needs in an often ambiguous, fast paced and changing environment.
  • Astute and inspiring learning facilitator and trainer.
responsibilities:
• Co-drive an Equity, Inclusion and Diversity (EID) experiential learning path, curriculum and strategy.
  • Create and facilitate short and long-term learning experiences that are scalable.
  • Design and implement innovative approaches to learning and development to increase racial and gender equity that transform mental models, behaviors and cultural dynamics.
  • Design learning experiences that go beyond existing EID learning and development models, approaches and curriculum. Conduct and integrate applicable academic and industry research to your design and curriculum.
title: Equity and Inclusion Learning Experience Designer
